conversations.body_text:
From what I can see on Reddit. Some people are saying ground the control
box. But I do not think that's my problem being I'm getting nothing. But
I'm going to try that today. I planned on doing a full review on YouTube.
Hopefully we can get this working. I have a dedicated u s b cable going
from the control box  to the pc. On a u s b 3.1 one gen two. Again, I do
not think grounds is gonna fix it.Being i'm getting no signal out of the
box at all , most of these people were just getting false signals. If I get
no joy out of these motors in 2 weeks I'm sending them back including the
3rd motor I ordered off your site. Will go simmagic. There seems to work
out of the box.. But hopefully we Can turn this review into a good one.
They're new on the market so I can understand some growing pains.

On Sat, Aug 23, 2025, 1:59 AM service@simsonn.com

I was able to get them working after installing driver 2.1 would show a
firmware update.You really should put the newest drivers on top. But the
pedals feel super weak even at 100%. Should I be running the V4 is that the
newest?

Hi Mike Nev,  The Pro X control box currently does not support bidirectional motor movement. It works very well with VAM, but the strength is slightly weaker when driving VAM Pro. If you require stronger vibration, we recommend upgrading to the Pro X Ultra control box, which provides more force than Simagic. Also, you do not need to use the V4 version, as V4 is only for Pro Plus devices.       https://www.simsonn.com/products/simsonn-vam-pedals-haptic-reactor?variant=51399342293306

I have the pro x ultra pedals. So that was not the problem. Had some issues
with your software. Motors kept dropping out after a couple laps ended up
using SIM hub. Having it boot with the computer and giving Admin rights and
it actually works fine now.  Until I gave sim hub Admin rights. They would
drop out after a few laps. Sim hub would not detect them. Your software did
not ether. But After many hours on reddit I got it finally to work well.
